ngoList.title: THE JUVENILE THEATRE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Juvenile Theatre, Kongba Kshetri Leikai, Imphal East is one of the premiere cultural organisation in Manipur. The main object for establishement is to promote traditional and modern theatre. It was registered in the year 1983 having registration No. 4486 of 1983 vide Government of Manipur Notification No. 4486 dated July 25, 1983. The organisation produced 13 plays and 4(four) radio plays since its inception and recognised by the Directorate of Culture, Manipur, Manipur State Kala Akademi, Central Subject Natak Akademi and Ministry of Culture, Government of India. The general body in its meeting held on 05-01-2011 decided ti elect the following members as office bearers for the term 2011-2013. They are- 1. Dr. K. Basanta Singh - - President 2. shri P. Ibohal Singh - - Vice-President 3. Shri Oken Amakcham - - Secretary 4. Shri K. Shaymsundar Sharma - - Treasurer 5. Shri Lalitkumar Singh - - Member 6. Km. P. Memtombi Devi - - Member 7. Shri Somokanta Singh - - Member

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Institution has been working in the field of Sankirtan specially Manoharshai Kirtan. This Kirtan has been nourished and developed in a great extent by the eminent Gurus of Manoharshai Kirtan of Manipur till date. Now the dedicated eminent Gurus of Manoharshai Kirtan have been working to develop the Manoharshai Kirtan of Manipur. One school of Manoharshai has been opened in Imphal and it imparts training for a one year course of Manoharshai Kirtan. Beside this, it conducts workshops, seminars, festivals, symposium on Manoharshai across the country. It nurtures and preserves the Manohashai Sankritan of Manipur culture.

ngoList.title: The Western Women Development Association
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Details of Achievement Major Activities/Achievement : (Not more than 500 words). The Western Development Women Association is now promoting its activities at some villages of Imphal West District. The name of village are 1. Ngairangbam 2. Khumbong 3. Awang Khunou 4. Tairenpokpi 5. Atong Khuman. The NGO is helping a maximum of more than 100 houslholds into their livelihood with management of income generation sources as possible as its capacity in the field of food processing unit a home, promotion of vegetable vendor, tailoring and agarbathi making unit etc. Beginning its activities in welfare programmes as HIV/AIDS , awareness for rural health, skill development activities and other activities related in traditional arts and cultures, the Association seeks its point of action for the welfare of the Rural women in peopleâ€™s participation which can involve the need of the welfare with conservation of eco-system and eco-resource such as programmes on social forestry for planting different species, programmes on agricultural land management to produce various kinds of agricultural crops in winter and vegetables. The Association gave awareness campaign programme for social upliftment in helath and for the welfare of the small children. The The Western Women Development Associationorganized programmes in health relation education programme, programme for disabled women, programme for 45 days life skill education Programme, other socially oriented awareness programmes such as women and child welfare programme, research and analysis for social issues, commercial sex worker welfare programme, IDUS,MSM Targetted intervention programme, Dru De-addiction Welfare Programme, widows welfare and development progaramme etc. The Association also have organized some skill development vocational training programmes such as 3-months computer training programme which was conducted at its project area in the month of October to December 2007 . The Western Women Development Association and its staffs always share the action of coordination through meetings at the project villages with teir respective Gram Panchayats. The NGO also established some small based peopleâ€™s participatory programmes as a part of influe3nce in social action for a creative life at the project village of Imphal West District. The Programmes ae as follows- Aged Welfare Programme, Disabilities Welfare Programme, capacity building and training in various trade, sports development programme etc. All the above programmes are organized as orientation and mom-residentaial camps at some spots of the project areas for about 5-6 days only. In addition of the above activities the Western Women Development Association have achieved the organization of Self Help Group to meet each other year by year. There are more 5 SHGs within the jurisdiction of this association. At present, the Association is preparing programme calender at which the type of activities to be implemented from the finding agencies. The Western Women Development Association is creating a sense of belongingness in broad and collected efforts to bring greater creditability to the degraded villages as a whole. Besides these the Association is taking up needful action for attracting greater in the financial and other forms of support from the funding agencies and doners. More over, the The Western Women Development Associationis creating a role of productive programmes in many activities to the women SHGs so as to maintain themselves in their village livelihoods. (H. Ibetombi Devi) Secretary

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The organisation had conducted 5 days training and awareness programme on SHGs at Organisation Training Hall. The main objective of the training is to improve the role of the leaders of women Self Help Group and to develop activity of book keeping and accountancy knowledge among the Secretary, President and treasurer respectively. Altogether 35 women leaders were participated in the said programme. The organisation had organised 5 days Family Counselling Programme. Resource from the concerned Department had provided their valuable support in this programme. The Programme was successfully conducted. In order to upgrade the modern technique and skill, the Organisation has conducted a three month Handloom and Handicraft cum Production at Imphal West District in 2015. During the training programme skill trainer from Concerned Department demonstrated with modern tools and equipment and designs. The programme was participated by 30 women from the area and distributed training materials and training by products and finished products are of the income source of the organisation. A one day workshop on Women and Child labour Welfare Programme has been conducted on the importance of food and nutrition for pregnant women at the premises of the association on 2014. About 85 participants including community leaders and students took part in the programme. IEC and other related leaflet publish by the Forest and Environment was also distributed to the participants. Two days Handicapped Women and Child Welfare Programme were organised at Thangmeiband Yumnam Leikai, Imphal West District. Resource from concerned Department had provided their valuable support in this programme. Free health check-up and medicines were mobilized from the Medical Representatives and 84 patients were benefited from this programme. To advance and facilitate the rural students in bringing quality education in the state the organisation organised a Library awareness Programme. The programme entertained students from Class 5-12 and above. 12 committed professional teachers conducted the campaign of which the teachers volunteered to render their services during the programme. The organisation conducted a programme by engaging 2 resource persons on the theme of Adult Education to the Women Labourer about the concept of reading and writing and calculating arithmetic method.40 students were choosen from economically backwards families benefited from the said training programme.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Organisation has implemented 6 (six) batches of 15 Days Design and Technical Development Workshop were conducted at Wangoo Cluster, and 2 batch of Skill Upgradation Training Programme Artistic Textile and Embroidery at Wangoo Cluster under AHVY Scheme sponsored by O/o the Development Commissioner Handicrafts, New Delhi. The organisation is running a Short Stay Home at Nagamapal Kangjabi Leirak Manung with the sponsorship of the Central Social Welfare Board, Ministry of Women and Child Development, New Delhi for destitute women/girls. In this home 30 destitute women/girls and 10 children are being provided shelter and rehabilitation. About 200 Handloom weavers are being trained with skill up gradation, marketing, management, etc, a Handloom Development Project under the Cluster Development Programme (CDP) at Moidangpok, Imphal West District, Manipur under the sponsorship of NABARD. The Womenâ€™s Worth Organisation had conducted one day Awareness Programme on Handloom Cluster at Moidangpok, Imphal on 28th February 2009 under CDP sponsored by NABARD. Mr. P. Bulte, Manager NABARD. The Womenâ€™s Worth Organisation had organized an Exhibition cum sale â€œNingthibee Collectionsâ€ from 5th October 2009 to 20th November 2009 at the premises of the organisation in which 20 other firms/organizations/SHGs had participated. The Organisation is also implementing Support to Training and Employment generation Programme (STEP) under the Sponsorship of Ministry of Women and Child Development, Govt. of India, New Delhi.The Organisation has conducted 6 months Integrated Design & Technical Development Project at Moidangpok, Imphal West sponsored by O/o the Development Commissioner Handicrafts, New Delhi

ngoList.title: Ukhrul District Handloom And Handicraft Cooperative Federation Limited
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: M/S Ukhrul District Handloom And Handicraft Cooperative Federation Limited (UDHAHCOF) is a regional apex organisation of Handloom And Handicraft Cooperative societies.It has 195 Cooperative society with more than 100 member in each society.UDHAHCOF tirelessly works to empower the artisans of the District by promoting the products in the form of exhibition,exposure Visit,Buyer And Seller Meet etc.It has a training centre and common facility centre to encourage mass production from both weavers and Handicraft artisans. UDHAHCOF opens three sale outlet 1)Lajpat Nagar, New Delhi 2) Tangkhul Avenue,Imphal, 3) Phungreitang main Bazar,Ukhrul Headquarter.It also provide Raw Material Bank facility to sell yarn at mill gate price besides distributing some raw material to poor and efficient artisans. UDHAHCOF is a recipient of Best Cooperative (Hills) for the year 2008 & 2015 for excellent performance in the field of Cooperative movement,awarded by Govt of Manipur.It also owns certificate of Importer Exporter Code No.1410002861(dt of issue 9/12/2010) issued by GOI,Ministry of Commerce And Industry,Office of Jr.Director General Of Foreign Trade 781024,Devt. Officer,Guwahati. TIN No. 14510224138 Manipur Value Added Tax Rule 2005,Issued on 13/3/2007 by Govt of Manipur. Handloom Mark Registration No.HLM=KOL-46-A30007 issued on 28/07/2014 by Regional Office of the Textiles Committee,Kolkata,GOI,Ministry Of Textiles. Institute Of Cooperative Management (ICM),Imphal confer Shrimp Kongjam Lukhoi Best Management Cooperative Award 2015 to UDHAHCOF.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: ministry of textiles office of the development commissioner handicrafts
sourceOfFunds.purpose: yarns are purchased through national handloom development cooperate ltd Guwahati. 185 primary weavers cooperation societies and 175 self help group , altogether 21000 handicraft artisans benefited from the raw material bank. the finished products are then sold in the emporium. the grant has been helpful for the development and encouragement to the artisans from rural and ST areas.

30 artisans received training for tribal textile and 30 artisans receives training for embroidery for two months each course. it targets the rural ST areas and those residing in the borderline areas of Burma and other undeveloped areas. the trained artisans then earn their daily livelihood through the products they now make.

the grant was received for mobilisation and awareness camp. 500 handicraft artisans attended the meeting at the town hall. one week of seminar workshop on handicraft is organised. village areas around the district participated in the workshop. some raw materials specially yarn are given out to the poor and efficient artisans.

the following programmes have been undertaken. 1.exhibition at ukhrul town hall. 2.embroidery training for 20 artisans from rural areas for duration of three months. 3.embroidery training for 20 artisans for artisans from rural areas for four months. 4. tribal textiles training for 20 artisans from rural ST areas for four months. the training are done as per the government guidelines. many artisans from rural backward areas participated and are now earning their livelihood through the training.
